intro: Onosma echioides var. brachyphylla, commonly known as the short-leaved hedgehog flower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and distinctive spiny flower clusters. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. Its flowers, which bloom in shades of blue to violet, attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. This variety is noted for its compact growth habit and ornamental value in gardens.
